metadata.title: CVE-2019-10784 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: phppgadmin through 7.12.1 allows sensitive actions to be performed withoutvalidating that the request originated from the application. One such area,"database.php" does not verify the source of an HTTP request. This can beleveraged by a remote attacker to trick a logged-in administrator to visita malicious page with a CSRF exploit and execute arbitrary system commandson the server.

criterions.comment: phppgadmin: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
